You have a keen eye for treasure. This is good, as every contribution counts.
It is wise to keep the supply line flowing swiftly.
The sweet chime of coin is music to the ears of any man.
Greed is not greed when it benefits a righteous cause such as ours.
Warriors deserve the finest food, especially if for some it is their last meal.
Do not allow your men to grow too plump in their feasting.
It is a good thing we are allies, otherwise there would be no treasures left for me to discover.
Never have I met a commander with a such a taste for treasure. You put me to shame.
I will allow you to take what is mine this once but please look elsewhere in the future.
Do you wish to offend me, my friend? Save some riches for the rest of us.
It delights me to see a fresh warrior for our cause.
You summon warriors to you. The powerful recognize one of their own.
More subjects join you. Remember. How you treat your servants is how you treat your empire.
Every man who sees you in battle wishes to pledge you his allegiance.
Use this precious resource with care. Trees grow scarce.
In the heat of battle, your archers will thank you for this wood.
Our empire stretches in every direction, a product of your cunning strategies.
You have shown that despite the enemy's strength, the people of this land are on our side.
A sly move, my friend. You have put us in a very advantageous position.
I see now that your steady pace has all been part of a larger plot. Well done.
A wall is only effective when paired with an aggressive strategy.
You make a wise choice. An enemy can only harm those within his reach.
I have learned that natives must be bought with gifts and protection. I have made the first move.
One can only win over the people of his empire if he holds out a hand in peace.
As usual, I have chosen to set an example. This trade site will contribute much to our alliance.
The land will always provide for the Son of Heaven.
I gather riches easily, like a child at play.
The glint of gold has given me hope for this campaign.
The battle will rage on, thanks to the addition of coin to my coffers.
My men will rejoice at this discovery of food.
I only collect these riches because we are allies. Normally, I would have left them to you.
This treasure lies close to your headquarters. I will share it, if you so desire.
You are a steadfast warrior but a terrible treasure hunter. How do you expect to fund this war?
I have tried to stay silent, but one emperor cannot support two empires. Search for treasure.
I have come upon warriors willing to fight beside our men.
These warriors have seen much bloodshed and will make a fine addition to our army.
These villagers are the foundation of our army. Every last one of them is an asset.
This is good. Strong villagers are needed to help our empire grow beyond its borders.
Wood serves us better tucked in quivers than lying on the forest floor.
Any veteran commander will tell you, wood fuels the fire of victory.
More natives hurry to join us.
Ambition has its rewards. Our empire grows, surpassing the blight of our enemy.
One more trade site has fallen under our influence, putting us in the lead.
I would like to see our enemies reach me now.
Even with these impassable barriers, my gates are always open to you.
Victory is within sight, but the enemy slithers in the grass, waiting for a time to strike.
We have worked hard for this fortunate position. I only hope we can maintain it.
Forget past tragedies and focus on the battle ahead. It is an opportunity to reclaim lost glory.
You have ventured into the world and found defeat. Do not worry, for every failure teaches us a lesson.
You return to me a seasoned warrior, with the blood of many victories on your hands.
Fresh scars mark you, my friend. Your enemies did not stand a chance.
I look forward to benefiting from your experience. Together we will prove unstoppable.
Much has changed since our last encounter. You have grown into a masterful commander.
I fought my hardest, but in the end the better warrior won the day.
It has been an honor knowing you, but it appears my time on this Earth is finished.
You have only seconds left. Enjoy them.
Take one last look at the beauty surrounding you. Your end is near.
So many men, so much death. Come morning, many mothers will weep for their lost sons.
It is as if the spirits themselves fight for our fates. I have never witnessed such a conflict.
No ruler wins the greater war without losing one or two of the smaller battles.
Some battles do not end as you expected. To dwell on defeat is a fool's game.
It appears that this day belongs to me. Do not lose faith. Tomorrow is another day.
I hope you learn something from this defeat and improve your skills for our next meeting.
With your passion for victory and my long history of it, this will be a battle for the ages.
Stories of your exploits are well known to me. You have my respect and my admiration.
My allies' men fight for me as they would for their own commanders. This is true allegiance.
Do you see? My ally is loyal even as the blood flows. Can you say the same of your allies?
This battle turns, but without the aid of your ally you would have been mine. Remember that.
There must be something about you that I do not see. Your ally rushes to your aid like a man possessed.
Your advancement means little to me. I have more important things to do than gaze upon your every development.
An empire that advances hastily very rarely stands the test of time. Such is my philosophy.
Your seizure of this village does not bother me. If I had wanted it, I would have taken it.
Those poor natives. They do not understand to whom they have pledged their loyalty.
The blood of those innocents is on your hands. Murder is a tool of the weak.
You can kill those who serve me, but you will never kill their devotion.
My headquarters may fall into shadow, but the sun has not yet set on my empire.
This is not a final blow against my army. No. It is simply one more excuse to destroy you.
Congratulations. But cutting down one tree will not remove the forest.
I will not worry. When one trade site falls, another takes its place.
I do not wish to lay waste to your empire without a fight. Please advance and make yourself a more worthy opponent.
Your villagers outnumber your soldiers three to one. Are you building an army or a pig farm?
Have I disrupted your plans so much as to keep you from advancing?
This behavior is not in keeping with your wisdom. Why does your civilization languish?
Such a beautiful civilization. It is a shame I will soon leave it in ruins.
You deserve all praise given. Your civilization is indeed magnificent.
My subjects have been asking the gods for your advancement. They felt guilty fighting such a shiftless people.
Welcome to this age of wonder. Unfortunately, we cannot share our discoveries with you.
You try to surround me with your towns. But remember. Scattered towns are weakened towns.
Your dying shouts will not be heard, for your friends are too far away.
It is too easy. I could crush all of you at once, like a line of ants beneath my foot.
A single blow could wipe your kind from the map. You and your allies might wish to relocate.
Your victory rises to the sky as smoke. You do not have the might to win this fight.
A dog that bites his master must be reminded of his place. Do not try to win that way again.
I deplore such acts of destruction, but I have no choice other than to destroy this site.
These natives have paid the price for their misguided allegiance.
From this point on, the battle turns for the Son of Heaven. It is over.
As this town center collapses, so do your dreams of glory.
What a pity. That trade site could have aided my army.
You practically begged for me to destroy that site. I hope you have learned a lesson.
You look well. Let us hope something good comes from this unfortunate conflict.
If there is a way to avoid this barbaric affair, please tell me now. I detest unnecessary death.
You have grown bolder and braver since our last encounter. It does not go unnoticed.
Is this a joke? Do you truly wish to face such steep and bloody challenges?
Our last engagement must have tormented you. This lack of confidence is not in your character.
A warrior never fights with half his heart, and no battle is easier than the last.
I have not been able to rid my mind of this setting. Too many of my men have died here.
There is no such thing as an easy battle. Despite the odds, you will suffer greatly before defeat.
Be warned, you will face many obstacles on the path to victory. More than you are used to.
Once again, my monk is safe. That was no way to treat a man of peace.
Your men tour my dominion. Surrender now and they will not be harmed.
I have your warriors in sight. Please, this is your last chance to give up and claim defeat.
I see warriors in the distance. They make easy targets for my archers.
Any man can field an army, but it takes a leader to wield it. Which one are you?
I see our respect is not mutual. Why have you sent men to my town?
Your warriors flirt with disaster. Call them back before it is too late.
What a heinous act. I expected more from you than this brand of cowardice.
It is mercy, not murder, that makes a ruler great.
That shaking is not the earth but the army marching over it. You should be feared.
I hope you do not plan to use your army for an attack. There must another solution.
I had hoped to find friendly faces in my territory, not the harsh gazes of warriors.
Please, disband your army before I do it for you.
There is no honor in striking a man at home, burning his farms, killing his families.
You have wandered too far from your own domain. Turn back now or face the consequences.
I hope this tiny band is not representative of your military might.
My empire is not a public garden. Have your men stroll elsewhere.
I stare into the exposed heart of your empire.
I have found you. Now we can begin the negotiations for your surrender.
This has been a fierce competition, but the victor was never in doubt.
I am impressed with your tenacity, but the victory is still mine.
This chapter in our relationship must end. Draw your sword, the time has come.
That is not thunder, my friend. That is the sound of marching feet, the sound of your destruction.
Do not be offended by my silence. I am simply looking after the needs of my people.
Will you not reconsider this foolish war? My warriors crave your blood.
There is no place left for this old warrior. I must admit defeat in the eyes of my enemy.
I will not allow my people to suffer any longer. Will you accept my surrender?
I should be outraged by this act, but I would have done the same thing myself.
You rush to make this land your own, but I believe its natives will have an opinion on this matter.
Many factors contribute to victory. Your number of trade sites impresses, but ultimately means nothing.
I see you have won the race for resources. Everything in battle is a race.
You should set your sights on the battlefield and not on scattered treasures.
You have worked hard to hoard these riches. I hope you can hold onto them.
Gold, not steel, is the weapon of war. You are smart to seek it.
Enjoy the food. Your men have fought bravely, and earned it.
A great man provides for those in need. Your people will be thankful for the food.
I could learn much from such an aggressive gatherer.
Do not venture too close, my friend. It is best not to poke a sleeping tiger.
Strong rulers obtain their own treasures. They do not steal them from another.
Your new warriors will fight fiercely. I will have to call up extra soldiers.
The more men that join you, the more you seem worthy of their allegiance.
Villagers have pledged their lives to you. Perhaps you are mightier than I thought.
You wisely take what the forest provides.
A wall will not resist my armies. Do not waste time on it.
A wall is a good defense. But will it hold?
Other villages will see this example and bow down to the Son of Heaven.
It has begun. Soon all peoples will be absorbed into my empire.
In your hands, these trade sites would become corrupted. It is best if I take them.
So starts the Qing's trade dominance over these lands.
Do not make me feel selfish. Please, find some treasure for yourself.
This land is ripe with wealth. You should take advantage before everything has vanished.
I do not need more riches, but I will gladly deprive you of them.
Would you like to share this food with me? Your men look thin and sickly.
I cannot believe you have left this unattended for so long.
A poor opponent is a weak opponent. Do not make me share my wealth with my enemy.
The greatest warriors fight for the Qing. Others fight for whoever will take them.
More servants join my cause. A ruler knows he is beloved when men flock to him.
This wood will contribute nicely to your funeral pyre.
Despite your best efforts, you will not turn the natives of this land against me.
A wise move, yes, but one you will pay for in the end.
I have noticed your bid for victory. Did you think I would not try to stop you?
Time passes swiftly. Now, all I have to do is wait.
Do not worry. Every warrior suffers a defeat from time to time.
You have been a formidable opponent to lesser foes than I.
Your previous battles have earned you a reputation. Unfortunately, it means little to a veteran like me.
You are an enemy with a wealth of experience. Unfortunately it looks paltry compared to mine.
This appears to be the end, but it is not. There are many other things worth living for.
The dark skies clear for the Son of Heaven. Victory is at hand.
"Excellent work men! We've won."
"Excellent work men! We've won."
"Get more soldiers ready!"
"Get more soldiers ready!"
"Get more soldiers ready!"
"We don't have the man power to take on his main army."
"I knew you were the man for the job."
"Good."
"Good."
"Excellent!"
"We need to get the men busy building proper quarters."
"Excellent work everyone. The colonial army has survived to fight another day."
"We have no choice, we must reorganize and refit.
"Yes."
"I will supply you with addtional artillery units."
"I will supply you with addtional artillery units."
"I will supply you with addtional artillery units."
"Soon, the new recruits need training."
"I will supply you with addtional artillery units."
"Soon, the new recruits need training."
"Soon, the new recruits need training."
"I will supply you with addtional artillery units."
"Soon, the new recruits need training."
"The colonial army has no money right now."
"No."
"We don't have the man power to take on his main army."
"No."
"Soon, the new recruits need training."
"Be careful."
"Good."
"Intercept him before he cuts our supply line."
"It's time!"
"It's time!"
"I knew you were the man for the job."
"Good."
"Excellent!"
"Excellent work men!"
"Excellent work men!"
"Concentrate on the main base!"
"Excellent work men!"
"Intercept him before he cuts our supply line."
"Concentrate on the main base!"
"Intercept him before he cuts our supply line."
"We have no choice, we must reorganize and refit."
"I need help!".
"I need help!".
"I'm Colonel Washington."
"Welcome to the New World!"
"Welcome to the New World!"
"Welcome to the New World!"
"You have located the enemy colony!"
"You have located the enemy colony!"
"You have located the enemy colony!"
"I have extra coin."
"I have extra food."
"I have extra wood."
"Concentrate on the main base!".
"Attack now!"
"Concentrate on the main base!".
"Attack now!"
"Attack now!"
"Are you ready?"
"This base will do just fine."
"In the mean time we should establish a base here."
"Maybe some of the local tribes have some food they can give us."
"Perfect."
"We're under attack!"
"We're under attack!"
"We're under attack!"
"We're under attack!"
"We're under attack!"
"I have extra coin."
"I have extra food."
"I have extra wood."
"Reinforcements have arrived."
"Do you have extra resources?"
"I need coin."
"I need food."
"I need wood."
I knew the enemy was lost once your forces showed up.
"Our combined forces on the battlefield, is there a better duo?"
"Thank you my little upstart, your troops, although not needed, were welcomed for joining my forces in that battle."
I shall put this coin to good use.
Your generosity is greatly appreciated.
"My base survives because of you, thank you."
The goods you sent me will not go to waste.
This wood will build many great structures in my town.
Our outcome looks bleak when looking at the strength of the British player.
If anyone could put us between a rock and a hard place I should have known it would be the Dutch.
The French ride all over us as yet we can not stop them.
The Ottomans are mighty. They will surely be the cause of our demise.
(Sighs) When did the Portuguese become so tough?
Seems the Russians are as many and as strong here in the New World as they are back home.
The Spanish are everywhere. I do not know if we can defeat them.
All is not lost. The British are barely holding on.
The situation is not in our favor but the Dutch are conformable.
We need to turn the tide of this contest but I sense the French are no real threat to us.
It seems the Germans are lost and sputtering out of control.. Through them we might be able to change our future.
The enemy seems too strong but I think the Portuguese are their weak link.
We may be behind right now but the Russians shouldn't last much longer.
We're not doing so well but the Spanish are doing even worse.
"Please forgive me, I fear I will be the cause of our great alliance not prospering as it should."
You are the pinnacle of our strength my little upstart. But I'm not sure you'll be enough to get us out of this one.
"Looks like the end is near, I do not think my strength is enough to hold for the both of us."
I will have to train you to be more my equal so that we may crush our enemies instead of them crushing us.
Our combined strength is unmatched.
It seems you're keeping up with me quite well my little upstart. The enemy no longer has the strength to stand up to our power.
This alliance has brought me great prosperity. You're better than I imagined you could be.
"Looks like I will ride to glory again, on your coattails of course."
"It's okay your nation isn't as strong as mine, I'll take us both to victory."
"Don't worry my little upstart, I'm doing well enough for the both of us."
"This battle is lost, if we resign now perhaps we can fight together another day."
We fought the good fight but we've been beaten.
"All is lost, let us resign and take them on again."
We've missed our chance at victory. Let us resign and fight again.
They have forged the first alliance with the natives here but it will be their last.
The enemy is looking to increase their wealth by building on a trade site.
They are forging more native alliances. We might see more native warrior on the field they we can handle.
"They've built another trade post, they must be stopped."
"Good move, your natives will surely help crush our enemies."
I'm sure the enemy is quite jealous of your new trade post.
Nice work! That treasure should be helpful.
Resources and units from treasures are always A nice bonus.
Extra coin to your coffers. Spend it wisely.
You should use that food to build more settlers and expand your economy.
You must be a skillful leader to take such advantage of the treasures around you.
As long as you put that treasure to good use I won't mind you taking it from my lands.
"Native warriors, a welcome addition to any army."
Extra settlers should really help to get your economy going.
Extra wood is never a bad thing to have.
Having the upper hand with the natives in this region definitely favors our side.
Having more trade sites helps create a wealthier nation and I believe a wealthy nation is a strong nation.
Wall defenses should hold the enemy back for a time.
"Are you getting scared my little upstart? Don't fret, my forces will protect you as well."
"It seems our enemy underestimates the power of these natives, but I do not."
Like a good businessman a leader must look for ways to improve his wealth and thats what this trade post will do for me.
What's this? My explorer has done something useful. Haha!
I will use this treasure to strengthen both our nations.
These treasures are very useful. Do you see some more?
The rich just keep getting richer.
This extra food will help feed my nation.
"I have been eyeing this treasure for some time now. Since you didnt take it, I did."
You should try to find some more treasures. They're really a boost to any nation.
"If you wish to be powerful and wealthy like me, you need to find more treasures my little upstart."
I shall use this Native warrior to scout and destroy our enemies.
Maybe I'll use this wood for a market or bank.
I couldn't let those tyrants have more native alliances in this region than us.
"More trade sites means more wealth, and you know I like being wealthy."
The enemy forces are making me nervous so I'm putting up some walls so they cannot surprise me.
Four of a kind! Lets research the victory condition and put an end to this war.
Are you an imposter? Because your skill rating was much higher the last time we played.
I see you've been practicing my little upstart. Your skill rating is much higher than I last remember it.
I see you've gained quite a bit of experience since we played last. I hope your home city is more powerful to show for it.
You might defeat me this time but know it won't be easy to do again.
Only 1 minute until the end. Can you feel the pressure?
"What a glorious fight, many heroes will be born today."
"You should turn and run, this battle does not look good for you."
Are those the only troops your nation could afford?
"I'm telling you this as an enemy that respects you, you should retreat."
"My ally has come to save me, dont you wish you ran while you had the chance?"
I see you could not face me alone. Obviously begging your ally for assistance.
Your technological advances will not save you from the wrath of my forces.
How did you manage to age up so quickly? You must tell me your secret.
Those natives will not be enough to stop my forces.
You have saved yourself the wrath of many native warriors by destroying that trade post.
My Town Center is lost but I am not.
Drat! That trade post was bringing me much wealth.
"Please advance the age, I dont want to destroy another nation of barbarians."
Are you aware of my technological advances? Perhaps you should try to catch up.
Rushing up age will not guarantee you victory in the end.
A little slow on your age advancement I see. Perhaps you need a minute before I attack?
Your Town Center is far from your ally. After I destroy this one I'm sure you'll build your next one a lot closer to him.
"Building next to your ally is the best decision you've made all game, my little upstart."
Did you think I would allow you to win in such a manner?
Your native alliance was making you too powerful so I ended it for you.
Your towncenter is lost. You will be as well if you do not make the smart decision and resign now.
"I know the wealth a trade post can provide, therefore I couldn't allow you to keep yours much longer."
"You could go back to your family."
"Check in your pocket. The quarter, is me too."
"Check in your wallet. That's me on the dollar bill."
"You could go back to your family."
You could not stop me from rescuing my explorer and I can not stop him from destroying your town.
My explorer is up but dont worry he's not much of a threat.
I see your forces with an explorer keeping an eye for them. Well done.
I just wanted you to know that force your explorer is leading round does not scare me.
"I'm warning you now, if those troops with your explorer come any closer to my town I'm going to have to take him out."
I see some of your units. They look lost. Where is your explorer?
Those troops look like an easy target for my men to train their skill.
For the safety of your own men you should keep them in your town and away from my forces.
It would be unwise of you to attack me with those forces near my base.
Only the weak prey on defenseless settlers.
You obviously need to attack settlers because my troops would cut yours to pieces.
My losses will be dwarfed compared to what I'm about to do to you!
Wow! Thats an impressive force I see.
Your force is of decent size but I would advise not attacking with it.
This will not bode well for me.
Is that what you call a raid??
I have found your town. Now I know where to strike.
"I have spotted your town and for now, it actually resembles mine in some ways."
"Well my little upstart, if you want that town of yours to survive you should surrender it to me now."
Its unfortunate that you could not get this treasure because it sure was helpful.
Ha! My army is on your doorstep!
I am here and prepared to fight!
"It is time to test your skills my little upstart, my army is upon you!"
I so enjoy having time to build upon my economy.
"I hope you're using this time wisely, my next attack is not too far away."
What do you do with your nation when I'm not attacking you?
"You have beaten me, and I would like to offer my surrender."
"I sense I can no longer obtain victory, may I resign now?"
Your actions have only delayed the inevitable.
"Nicely done, alliances with natives may be the path to victory in this conflict."
That trade post will not help you gain more wealth than my banks can produce.
"That is only one treasure, I will find many more than that."
Do you have the wisdom to use that treasure wisely?
It is better you got that treasure or I would have too great an advantage over you.
"Hmm, seems your explorer finds useful things to do with his time, unlike mine."
Will you be able to buy an army to beat me with that little bit of coin?
"A little bit of food, I'm not worried."
"You have an unfair advantage, your explorer is doing something useful."
"I left that treasure there as a trap, now I'm going to hunt your explorer down."
Natives are good but treasure will not be enough to help you in the end.
I'm sure I could put those settler to better use in my town.
That will just give me more building to tear down.
"A wise plan to wall in, but they won't be enough to save you."
I thought you were not afraid of me when we declared war on each other but these walls make me think differently.
"Be careful, soon native warriors will be attacking your town."
This trade post will only add to my wealth.
My explorer must really want to destroy you because he is actually helping to victory.
I'm sorry but I could not allow you to have this treasure.
More coin to my coffers!!
This will help me field an army greater than your.
Why do you leave such treasures for me on your lands? I guess you know those lands will belong to me soon enough.
Is your explorer dead? I haven't seen him.
You'll see him soon... attacking your town.
"Extra settlers for a wealthy nation, this cannot fare well for you."
"This wood will help me build a barracks or a bank, whichever."
That alliance won't last long.
That trade site will help you become almost as wealthy as me.
"Trying to take the easy win condition, eh my little upstart? I'll put an end to this nonsense."
Take the peaceful way defeat and just allow this timer to run out.
What happened to your rating? Been facing more leaders like myself?
"I see your rating is going up, are you ready for your next lesson my little upstart?"
I hope all that experience has made your homecity more powerful than the last time we met.
"Well my little upstart, I can't buy our way out of this one."
"Well, my little upstart, stick with me and do as I do. Successes like these will become old-hat."
You might defeat me this time but understand it won't be easy to do again.
Do not be so certain of your victory that you grow lax in these last moments.
Only one minute until the end. Can you feel the pressure?
If you simply resign you can save yourself the disgrace of waiting out my victory.
"A minor setback, we will still be victorious in the end."
Your actions have only delayed the inevitable.
Did you think I would allow you to win in such a manner?
Your countdown has stopped. What other tricks do you have up your sleeve?
We've missed our chance at victory. Let us resign and fight again.
"We have some difficult fighting ahead of us, my little upstart. We must be quick about it."
A trade monopoly at last! We will soon put an end to this war.
The Dutch are known for both diplomacy and trade. This will be a fitting victory.
"Trying to take the easy way out, eh, my little upstart? I'll put an end to this nonsense."
A victory by diplomacy and trade? I certainly didn't expect anything so civilized from you.
Accept your defeat and just allow this timer to run out in peace.
"There. I have dictated the time of your defeat, unless you are made of sterner stuff than I have yet seen."
